title: Brazil’s Central Bank Raises Benchmark Interest Rate to 11.75%, Signals More Tightening
sub_head: The benchmark Selic rate has now been raised at nine consecutive meetings
body:
SÃO PAULO—Brazil’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate Wednesday and signaled multiple increases could come this year amid the uncertainty and risks to inflation caused by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
The bank raised its benchmark Selic rate by one percentage point to 11.75%, leaving the lending rate at its highest level since 2017. The bank began its current tightening cycle early last year, when the Selic was at a record low 2%, and has now raised it at nine consecutive meetings.
